intro: Dorycnium amani, commonly known as the Amani sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, raceme-like clusters, which bloom in the spring. Dorycnium amani is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a forage plant for livestock.
